intro: Psychotria robynsiana var. pauciorinervata, commonly known as the lesser veined psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with fewer veins compared to other varieties of Psychotria. It produces small, white or pale green flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. This variant is often found in shaded, moist forest understories where it thrives in humid conditions.
